docs.lead_paragraph: A settlement that is expected to end a three-week boycott by pharmacists against filling Medicaid prescriptions was announced yesterday, and indications that some of the affected drugstores were already resuming service to Medicaid recipients.

headline.main: SETTLEMENT REACHED IN DRUGGIST BOYCOTT; Expected to End 3-Week Refusal by 600 to Fill Medicaid Orders in Reimbursements Protest 600 Pharmacists Joined

docs.abstract: NYC pharmacists to end 3-wk boycott of Medicaid prescriptions after NYS Soc Services Dept agrees to rev reimbursement rates and set higher prices in interim; Empire City Pharmaceutical Soc atty Jerome Sager lauds help of Comr Barbara Blum and Assemblyman G Oliver Koppell (S)
docs.snippet: A settlement that is expected to end a three-week boycott by pharmacists against filling Medicaid prescriptions was announced yesterday, and indications that some of the affected drugstores were already resuming service to Medicaid recipients.

docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 17--Warnings against the use of Mexican marijuana that has been sprayed with a herbicide that can physically damage humans have aroused alarm here and elsewhere in the nation.

headline.main: Warnings About Tainted Marijuana Alarming Users; Public Expressing Concern A 'Scare,' but Not Ignored Some Charging Exaggerations

docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, April 17--Warnings against the use of Mexican marijuana that has been sprayed with a herbicide that can physically damage humans have aroused alarm here and elsewhere in the nation.

byline.original: By LES LEDBETTER Special to The New York Times
